page.title: 04WOODLAND AREAS
page.content: DOVECLIFFE AND WOMBWELL WOODS TAKE UP OVER A SQUARE KILOMETRE AND AS WE PASSED THROUGH WE SAW THAT THEY CONSISTED MAINLY OF SYCAMORE AND SILVER BIRCH, BUT OAK, ASH AND WILLOW WERE ALSO THERE. THE TALLEST WERE ABOUT 14 METRES BUT MANY WERE SPINDLY THROUGH GROWING TOO CLOSE. THERE IS A 5 ACRE WOOD ON SWAITHE HALL FARM WHERE AGAIN SYCAMORE WERE PREDOMINANT AMONGST OAK, ASH, WILLOW, WHITEBEAM AND CHESTNUT. SYCAMORE OF 2O METRES WERE THE TALLEST AND ONE OR TWO HAD TRUNK GIRTHS OF 4 METRES. THE TREES HAD BEEN THINNED OUT IN THE PAST AND IT WAS A VERY ATTRACTIVE AND UNSPOILED PLACE. WE ALSO SAW SOME TREES WHICH HAD BEEN PLANTED ON A RECLAIMED PIT SPOIL HEAP IN WOMBWELL AND FROM A DISTANCE THEY LOOKED TO BE DOING WELL.
